timeline.message: Turn the Baggage metadata into a simple wrapper for a String.

Remove the method to parent via Baggage.
Parenting is still implemented via the Context.
Also, renamed many old variables and method to use the new baggage name.

Remove the method to parent via Baggage.
Parenting is still implemented via the Context.
Also, renamed many old variables and method to use the new baggage name.
Basic implementation of baggage header extraction.

timeline.bodyText: Hmm - do we need to expose the constructor publicly too to allow a different BaggageManager than the global?
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: I'm really hoping we can completely get rid of the BaggageManager once open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification#1070 is resolved. If the Baggage in the API isn't a no-op, then we don't have to worry about this thing.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: Not really for this PR but I guess it'd be nice to always return an empty baggage instead of null
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: agreed. Assuming no baggage and empty baggage are semantic identical.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: If there were an empty baggage check above, we wouldn't need this one guaranteed to inject something
timeline.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: Though disregard my above comments if no baggage is different from empty baggage semantically.
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: It's not clear to me, either, if no baggage and empty baggage are semantically different.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: Random noise from me - not sure what the difference between baggage and tracestate is, they're both propagated K-V pairs it seems. Anyways ;)
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: My feeling is: TraceState is a fixed format, semantically well-defined spec. Baggage is the wild west free-for-all for whatever users want to do.
replies.author: jkwatson
